the standard one for this card from lspci 'VGA compatible controller: Silicon Integrated Systems [SiS] 65x/M650/740 PCI/AGP VGA Display Adapter '
what video driver are you using in /etc/X11/xorg.conf for your video card?

this is my xorg.conf
what video card is in you machine?
from lspci it appears to be a 'VGA compatible controller: Silicon Integrated Systems [SiS] 65x/M650/740 PCI/AGP VGA Display Adapter '
in the Device section, try adding   Driver  "sis"
ok, brb
i added that line in the 'Monitor' section, and upon restarting X, it gave me an 'Ubuntu Low Resolution Warning' message, and still didnt work, even when i selected 1024x768 as the resolution
define "didn't work"
it is still at 800x600, what it was before i tried that
k.  to the xorg.conf, in the Screen section, add SubSection "Display <CR> Modes   "1024x768" <CR> EndSubSection    where each <CR> means hit the Enter key
can you paste the lspci output for your vid card again, as well
it appears that the low res warning config already added that
ill reboot just to be sure
that's good.  did it also add BusID to the Device section for your card?
it works!!!!!
i guess adding the driver line messed it up, loading that utility, which made it work :P
well thanks
